entries.meaning: (US) A children's play area consisting of a box filled with sand.
A box filled with sand that is shaped to form a mould for metal casting.
A container for sand or pounce, used historically before blotting paper.
(rail transport) A box carried on locomotives, from which sand runs onto the rails in front of the driving wheels, to prevent slipping.
(computing) An isolated area where a program can be executed with a restricted portion of the resources available.
examples: Running a program in a sandbox can prevent it from doing any damage to the system.

entries.meaning: (Wikimedia jargon) A page on a wiki where users are free to experiment without destroying or damaging any legitimate content.
(US, military, slang, usually "The Sandbox") The Middle East.

verbs.description: sandbox (third-person singular simple present sandboxes, present participle sandboxing, simple past and past participle sandboxed)

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive) To restrict (a program, etc.) by placing it in a sandbox.
